jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

9E3B48CBEDD044F2978D7AA717C2DD0E.description: Capitalize on opportunities to practice these skills within a liturgical context modeling Christ.

0AB46D1CA74D4205A86629DBF7E430EB.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

A90064C28F634D69ADD04A874173DBDD.description: Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

322B5296C879433F98AF8DED85754BA0.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen
details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

3E68AA9C04BC4EE291309037ED4E51AB.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence and
identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

26B1518625FA4DC5B9125D4F4D7081FC.description:
Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats including but not limited to Catholic texts and sources (e.g., visually,
quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its presentation.

9C37145A485A4B03AF5962A5B3904F87.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, have the humility to qualify or justify their own views in light of the
evidence presented.

E5B489B8CC6C4545B7F7CF53F53B627B.description:
Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations,
and ideas.

461E428D02FC4702AA56E08C3FE8B417.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as
needed.

D5EEF9F2B8104AE788694D8473C749A3.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study (including but not limited to Catholic texts and sources); explicitly
draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

EC8FB053C3E448AAB44797557E419FCE.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led), building on others’ ideas and expressing their own
clearly.

7526AFD8AE794BE098F8974BB143F38A.description: Delight and wonder through reading aloud or listening to creative, sound, and healthy stories, and poems and plays. CSDS7

3A6C41D08CE446EE8B78499CDDF46A1E.description: Share beautifully told and well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

B2E754AE096F4F198BD01BF14CD758D7.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

A6A26C6D4CBF4CE1B12A12426F7D3165.description: Interact with people, recognizing diversity, using discussion techniques and language that reflects Catholic teaching and values.

26F5CD6F25964A92BE5E55949F28C6B4.description: Catholic Standards for Speaking and Listening

D6C2705EED5D45E7AA1BF1F01471447F.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases (including faith literacy); gather vocabulary
knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

8739002CE01F4065A0F83A75F22E88CF.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

BE7EA71232784910A75540736EF54FC2.description: Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

C954B489A8464733B22FB52EFFDEE297.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

30230739C4BC4D3ABDDACE235E38F941.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

93E474D7ED9446E5B0FE8606AD25EF07.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

E0D8BC5DA2374817B66BDD96330592B4.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a
word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

81AE4A6F0616493CA27ABB3BD8AD6271.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, secede)

B07BB3EAF9EB4582BE0E32BB9B060151.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or
phrase.

674A104651434A96A9AC68359DCE323B.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on Grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a
range of strategies.

D1BD5A2BCA414D8391FB3E03B267DF23.description:
Use verbs in the active and passive voice and in the conditional and subjunctive mood to achieve particular effects (e.g., emphasizing the actor or the
action; expressing uncertainty or describing a state contrary to fact).

193BFB6636E4439D9592765F70FF0B41.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

45ED9CB2004342FABD0B1108FBE1AEF1.description: Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission.

474C17C25F244EFF9A736970E9716920.description: Use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.

4370BB0FC50743A3A5F84DD103888BAA.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

63F18D58CE18450FAE2D3FBCE025A073.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood.

3F830F7FED314E1E8074ED4D1BD53CD9.description: Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and subjunctive mood.

9EFDA19606F44BB09E8953CC365AB07E.description: Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

2242DA490BB143DABFC38F62FEB75EAA.description: Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in general and their function in particular sentences.

23106D0339DF4326B128DE561B666069.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking

15E15B62327D41C5A0CE336773EEEE98.description: Use language to order our thoughts and to accurately express knowledge and feelings. CSWS2

5C52C78126CD4133969805C4F7AF15B0.description: Use language as a bridge for communication for the betterment of all involved. CSWS1

211D03749AB14DC59AAD444A1C06E4A5.description: Exhibit an understanding that words are important to the Word.

EB40CD16DA04415EB67410D96F3B6AEF.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range
of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

B1C83E7E6EA54664A6B1FEEE57BA164F.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

94CE1058C2AD4CED8201C70E44220DFF.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources including an understanding and use of primary and secondary sources, using search
terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while exercising the virtue
of honesty and following a standard format for citation of images, sources, and ideas thus eliminating plagiarism.

625113D9D26648E595272FF2B2435510.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related,
focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

309DCEEB80D74A3D9B2304460AF3BB48.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

3C27BAFE9B2E4D78AE23465AC568060C.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing (including multi-media works reflecting a Catholic theme) and present the
relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

02D4DA472F214DFA866DDA4FA6390E93.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop, strengthen, and defend writing according to Catholic teaching as needed by planning,
revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

C1655CF27D9C4D93857642BD564F50AE.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. Examples may
include prayers, Catholic moral teachings, and reflective essays.

1BE7611D397F408AA1A56E246886BED7.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

BDB079B015B547E2B4C214712B981662.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

6A00B3404BA74AB8A8975D91DACA7737.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the
relationships among experiences and events.

7F78E2F041E24652AB3F9BFD63945A26.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters (character study may
detail the implicit and/or explicit Catholic virtues and values).

9857148249A945478E32971C8B417FF2.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that
unfolds naturally and logically.

26A60AF5BB624A9AA861FB9052EDA474.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event
sequences.

291A2292669A4E21992C04CAB8AC525B.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

61EC4A46500F476EA43142696908DA99.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

1F2E63F872EE47C88E34CB484ACB2F77.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

06F1A046F32F44B7B7BA66DEE2A44BBF.description: Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

E1FAF862FBC54867A46D773AAB2E92A4.description:
Develop the topic (including but not limited to a Catholic topic) with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples.

C5DBE29F8C8A414B8FA54B5FB8A1BF9D.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories; include formatting (e.g.,
headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

FCC750E4D710457F81450FAC323AF2D6.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of
relevant content.

5176327E48C941BA867092F1825DEF03.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

BE1BD7C5209D4BEEA0A44D168C9990FB.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

56F67D9F29A845B1AB5AF6930CF886DA.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

658CFF2181E046C8844F5AD5F3163F34.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources (including but not limited to Catholic texts) and
demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

4481A81204374FB6804FB7E5CF7720FC.description: Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

EF6AD146E4F44B4F91BB9125D40299AD.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence while maintaining Catholic values and identity.

F7893F99841F487AA1F0E696F506063B.description:
CSIS4: From a Catholic perspective, write to explain how to address critical issues, such as: What is the relationship between man and God? What is
the nature of human dignity? What is love? What is a good life?

E1D6E742198A4EBC9E4E84C78E944BA5.description: CSWS2: Write in a variety of ways to naturally order thoughts to the truth with an accurate expression of intent, knowledge, and feelings.

70B1F5BC542F479E827B5B1C1E10A333.description: Write in ways to naturally order our thoughts to the truth with an accurate expression of intent, knowledge, and feelings. CSWS2

51237D3E2A4D4BD09A508C60E4D878C4.description: Share well-crafted works, especially those with elements of unity, harmony, and radiance of form. CSDS4

2A5D8988F690480BB3D335E7960C7987.description: Create written works that glorify the Creator, reflect the heart of the Redeemer and are inspired by the Spirit.
